intro: Cerinthodes paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled cerinthodes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flower clusters that bloom in the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Cerinthodes paniculatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
